text: Hazaragi () spoken by the Hazara people in south Asia. == Classification == Hazaragi is a language which is related to Turkish, mongolian and Indo- European languages. It is easily distinguishable from other Turkic and Mongolic languages spoken in different countries in South Asia. Hazaragi contains some Turkic and Mongolic words. == Spoken area == Hazaragi is spoken by the Hazara people of central Afghanistan as well as by a large refugee population found in northeastern Iran and in parts of Pakistan, such as Quetta. == Related pages == * Aimaq dialect * Hazara people == References == Category:Hazara people Category:Languages of Pakistan Category:Languages of Afghanistan Category:Persian language
title: Hazaragi
